awe6.interfaces.IKernel

type
interface
implements
ILogger
IPauseable
Handles main updates and provides global locators for all managers

Instance Variables

assets(default,null) : IAssetManager

Assets manager.

audio(default,null) : IAudioManager

Audio manager.

factory(default,null) : IFactory

Build properties and factory methods to create the application.

inputs(default,null) : IInputManager

Inputs manager.

isDebug(default,null) : Bool

Defined by the IFactory, can be used for conditional logic relating to build modes and debug.

isEyeCandy(default,_set_isEyeCandy) : Bool

Toggleable by the user, intended to be used as a switch to disable intensive, but non essential, content (performance vs wow).

isFullScreen(default,_set_isFullScreen) : Bool

Toggleable by the user, enables or disables full screen mode.

isLocal(default,null) : Bool

Identifies a non network location, can be used for conditional logic relating to build modes and debug.

messenger(default,null) : IMessageManager

Messenger manager. Arbitrator for observer pattern across IEntityCollections.

overlay(default,null) : IOverlay

The topmost visual element, used for chrome & global controls.

scenes(default,null) : ISceneManager

Scene manager. State machine containing IEntities.

session(_get_session,_set_session) : ISession

Read and write globally accessible variables.

tools(default,null) : ITools

Helper methods.

Instance Methods

getConfig( id : String ) : Dynamic

parameters
ID Unique identifier for the config setting (e.g. XML node name).
returns
Value of the corresponding config setting.
Used for read only application settings and localisation text.

getFramerate( ?asActual : Bool ) : Float

parameters
?asActual Use actual framerate (potentially laggy), or the desired framerate (from IFactory).
returns
Frames per second.
Request the framerate of the application.

onPreloaderComplete( preloader : IPreloader ) : Void

parameters
preloader Corresponding IPreloader.
Internal method called when preloader completes; launches the starting scene as defined by IFactory.startingSceneType.
